channel.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
channel.description:
Suppose Bill is a healthy man without family or loved ones. Would it be ok painlessly to kill him if his organs would save five people, one of whom needs a heart, another a kidney, and so on? If not, why not? Consider another case: you and six others are kidnapped, and the kidnapper somehow persuades you that if you shoot dead one of the other hostages, he will set the remaining five free, whereas if you do not, he will shoot all but one. (Either way, he'll release you.) If in this case you should kill one to save five, why not in the previous, organs case? If in this case too you have qualms, consider yet another: you're in the cab of a runaway tram and see five people tied to the track ahead. You have the option of sending the tram on to the track forking off to the left, on which only one person is tied. Surely you should send the tram left, killing one to save five. But then why not kill Bill?
Let's get them juices flowing! Make sure you post why you agree or disagree with this. Not just "No." http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/7739493.stm

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @f_2_p_2_p_f f 2 p 2 p f
item.description:
@f_2_p_2_p_f wrote:

Illogical to think about the healthy man has A higher chance of living than the 5 without organs.

Read full topic

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“heatrn11, post:60, topic:450528”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=553416.msg4054755#msg4054755 date=1342832466]

Milkman: Your choice to sacrificing yourself is another thing. But if you sacrifice others you are a bastard.

But if you don’t sacrifice one person, 5 people will die in his place. Does that really make someone a bastard?
[/quote]
Just kill everyone and yourself, so you don’t have that shit on your conscious.[/quote]

That is actually very selfish. You can’t live with it so take everyone else down with you.

Read full topic

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @DevinCooley DevinCooley
item.description:
@DevinCooley wrote:

there is a book about this. It is call "Unwind’ google it. It is a very good book. Its basically about teenagers who are unwanted and sent to unwind camps where they are basically taken apart but completely painlessly. If anyone ever lost a needed a new body part they would use one from one of the unwound people. All diseases basically could be cured with these healthy body parts.

Read full topic
item.source: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

This reminds me of an ethics question:

You and some friends are going hiking into a cave. The entrance to the cave collapses and your friend bob is stuck underneath the debris, but with his head facing the outside. There is some water inside of the cave and it is slowly rising. You conveniently have a stick of dynamite and a box of matches in your pocket. Do you…
A) Blow up Bob and rescue everyone else trapped inside.
B) Let everyone including yourself die, but let Bob live.

Personally I would say sorry Bob, you were a nice friend and all, but I’d rather have 1 death on my conscience than 5.

As far as killing people for their organs… There is no need to. Plenty of people die of natural causes/not-so-natural causes every day. There’s no need to take a life that isn’t its time yet.

Read full topic
item.source: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

The way this is worded makes it seem like Bill and the healthy people have no choice, If Bill had a choice whether he was killed to save 5 I think it would be fine but if he has no choice then of course it is a completely wrong thing to do.

Read full topic
item.source: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

“For some to be immortal, many must die”

That is the thought that comes into my when when I think of this subject matter. The quote is from the movie “In Time” where everyone is genetically engineered to have a timer in them that starts when they turn 25, and they never age physically again. The time can essentially be controlled by those in power, and in turn, live for centuries. Killing people for healthy organs to sustain one’s life could be abused by those with money or power as well. If anyone has ever read the book “House of the Scorpion” they’d know that the main plot revolves around stopping this because it was used by drug lords, living much longer than normally possible.

Just thinking of the ways this could be abused can easily make this turn into a bad idea. Its fairly obvious that some political leaders would use this to continue their reign.

[size=1pt]this post wasn’t very well structured at all. i guess thats what happens when you post while tired as anything[/size]

Read full topic
item.source: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:53, topic:450528”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=553416.msg4057168#msg4057168 date=1343080524]
Human beings are worthless and a waste of space so anyone arguing either sides of this argument are wasting their time.
[/quote]
Could I harvest your organs? It is worth a decent chunk of money.[/quote]
Who said I said I don’t care about my life? I just stated that our lives are worthless. If your hinting money has value, it doesn’t. Things may have value to you but nothing has real value. Its like how perfection exists, perfection doesn’t exist but something may be perfect to a certain person. True value doesn’t exist but something may hold value to a certain person.

Read full topic

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:45, topic:450528”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=553416.msg4056399#msg4056399 date=1343006686]

The answer to “Would it be okay to kill Bill” is obviously no.

So you, according to scenario three, would direct it towards the 5 people instead of the 1 person.

Yes.

“Oh haay guys, I shot someone in the head so I could save five other people.”

You’re thinking too immaturely.

Immaturely?

Yes, a bit. You haven’t thought everything out before posing a question and proposing an answer.
[/quote]

Have you read the OP? it isn’t my question.[/quote]

Yes, I’ve read the question, but I’m sorry, this has got to be one of the worst threads created on MSCP.

[quote=“m1lkman, post:40, topic:450528”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=553416.msg4056127#msg4056127 date=1342981919]
The answer to “Would it be okay to kill Bill” is obviously no.
[/quote]

So you, according to scenario three, would direct it towards the 5 people instead of the 1 person.[/quote]

Nope. The scenarios are individual and you can’t compare them among themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:46, topic:450528”]In scenario one, only the 5 people are going to die. The one you are killing is not going to die unless you kill him, however…

In scenario two, EVERYONE is going to die anyways, so taking one life is better, as it saves everyone from dying. (If you will die, and so will everyone else, if you can minimize the casualties it’s better. It would be the only way out for everyone, except for the unlucky guy).[/quote]

He will die eventually.

Read full topic

item.title: Should we kill healthy people for their organs?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

In scenario one, only the 5 people are going to die. The one you are killing is not going to die unless you kill him, however…

In scenario two, EVERYONE is going to die anyways, so taking one life is better, as it saves everyone from dying. (If you will die, and so will everyone else, if you can minimize the casualties it’s better. It would be the only way out for everyone, except for the unlucky guy).
